Detailed Description

TreeNodes are branches of a planar tree graph that are used to describe the high-level structure of the game map.

Generally speaking, each node describes an edge in the graph that lies along a tunnel in the game. TreeNode instances handle the following tasks:

  • Expansion of the tree
  • Determination of tilesets and allowed map features
  • Loading map feature creation code
  • Fixing accessibility by placing platforms and carving junctions

  loc,
  parent = None,
  recurseDepth = 0,
  loopNode = None,
  isJunctionNode = False 
)

Create a new TreeNode instance.

Determine the local zone and region information, pick a tunnel feature type, and determine our tunnel width.

Return true iff the line from us to loc is not too close to any of our existing lines and doesn't form any overly-sharp angles.

def treenode.TreeNode.createConnections (   self  ) 

Try to create loops in the map, by finding nodes that are a large number of steps from us in the graph but are a short physical distance away.

def treenode.TreeNode.createFeatures (   self  ) 

Add any features we require now that tunnels and rooms have been carved out.

def treenode.TreeNode.createJunctions (   self  ) 

Carve a junction out of the map grid at our endpoint, if we have children or loops.

We have two types of junctions, circular and square, which may be set in the configuration for the region.

def treenode.TreeNode.createTree (   self  ) 

Make children.

We do this in a function call instead of in the constructor so we can build the tree breadth-first instead of depth-first. This prevents us from making a tree that has a very low branching factor near the root because available space was blocked up early.

def treenode.TreeNode.createTunnels (   self  ) 

Prepare the map for map.expandSeeds by laying down seeds according to our tunnel feature logic.

def treenode.TreeNode.draw (   self,
  screen,

)

Draw the tree.

This is strictly for debugging purposes.

Place platforms in our space to help make the map accessible to the player.

def treenode.TreeNode.fixAccessibilityVertical (   self  ) 

Ensure that vertical shaft tunnels are accessible by making a "spiral staircase" out of floating platforms.

def treenode.TreeNode.fixAccessibilityWallwalk (   self  ) 

Fix accessibility for generic tunnels by walking along walls and placing platforms wherever the walls are too steep or the ceiling is too far away.

Member Data Documentation

treenode.TreeNode.color

This color is used for debugging output only.

treenode.TreeNode.connections

A list of all nodes that are connected to us that aren't our children or our parent.

treenode.TreeNode.featureModule

The module that contains the information needed to create our tunnel feature type.

Determines if we should retry making children when generating the map.

treenode.TreeNode.isJunctionNode

Whether or not this particular node is a dummy node.

treenode.TreeNode.junctionChild

Link to a dummy node that takes up space at the connections in the tree.

treenode.TreeNode.loopNode

If this node is part of a loop, this is the node that forms the loop.

Distance since the last time this limb of the tree changed region types.

Information about the terrain we are in.

The tunnel feature type, e.g.

straight, bumpy, staircase.
